intro: Silene hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Silene hohenackeri is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
